org.jppf.management.diagnostics

Interface DiagnosticsMBean

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Diagnostics

    public interface DiagnosticsMBean
    Interface for the diagnostics MBean.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String MBEAN_NAME_DRIVER
      The name of this MBean in a driver.
      static String MBEAN_NAME_NODE
      The name of this MBean in a node.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Double cpuLoad()
      Get an approximation of the current CPU load.
      void gc()
      Perform a garbage collection.
      Boolean hasDeadlock()
      Determine whether a deadlock is detected in the JVM.
      HealthSnapshot healthSnapshot()
      Get a summarized snapshot of the JVM health.
      String heapDump()
      Trigger a heap dump of the JVM.
      MemoryInformation memoryInformation()
      Get the diagnostics info for the whole JVM.
      ThreadDump threadDump()
      Get a full thread dump, including detection of deadlocks.
      String[] threadNames()
      Get the names of all live threads in the current JVM.

      • memoryInformation

        MemoryInformation memoryInformation()
                                    throws Exception
        Get the diagnostics info for the whole JVM.
        Returns:
        a MemoryInformation instance.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs.

      • threadNames

        String[] threadNames()
                     throws Exception
        Get the names of all live threads in the current JVM.
        Returns:
        an arrray of thread names as strings.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs.

      • gc

        void gc()
        throws Exception
        Perform a garbage collection. This method calls System.gc().
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs.

      • threadDump

        ThreadDump threadDump()
                      throws Exception
        Get a full thread dump, including detection of deadlocks.
        Returns:
        a ThreadDump instance.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs.

      • hasDeadlock

        Boolean hasDeadlock()
                    throws Exception
        Determine whether a deadlock is detected in the JVM.
        Returns:
        true if a deadlock is detected, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs.

      • healthSnapshot

        HealthSnapshot healthSnapshot()
                              throws Exception
        Get a summarized snapshot of the JVM health.
        Returns:
        a HealthSnapshot instance.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs.

      • heapDump

        String heapDump()
                throws Exception
        Trigger a heap dump of the JVM. This will not work with all JVM implementations. It should work with Oracle standard and JRockit JVMs, along with IBM JVM.
        Returns:
        a message describing the outcome.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs.

      • cpuLoad

        Double cpuLoad()
        Get an approximation of the current CPU load. The computed value is equal to sumi(thread_used_cpui) / interval, for all the live threads of the JVM at the time of the computation. Thus, errors may occur, since many threads may have been created then died between two computations. However, in most cases this is a reasonable approximation, whose computation does not tax the CPU too heavily.
        Returns:
        the cpu load as a double value in the range [0, 1] (ratio of totalCpuTime / computationInterval), or -1d if CPU time measurement is not available for the JVM.
